moves.1... c6: Somewhere in chess heaven, Horatio Caro smiled.
moves.3... Bf5: The usual development of the B.
moves.5... e6: Locking in his strong point at Q4.
moves.6. Ne2: Defending the base of his Pawn chain.
moves.7... Ne7: Strengthening the QP and setting a trap.
moves.8... Qd7: Offering Adams a way out if he's willing to exchange Queens.
moves.9. Qxc5: Adams' greed gets the better of him.
moves.9... Nf5: After 10 Q-R5 P-QN3, Adams' Q would fall... so he resigns at once.

players: Weaver W. Adams  vs. George M. Kramer
